summary: Royalties on the sale of oil and gas produced on federal lands are a significant source of federal revenue. From 2012-2022, companies paid the U.S. government $74 billion in royalties. The Interior Department's efforts to ensure that companies pay the royalties they owe produced $600 million in additional payments in this period. title: Federal Oil and Gas Royalties: Opportunities Exist to Improve Interior's Compliance Program
